titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the papers of Bishop Platon uaoc.9
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Michael Andrec

publicationstmt.publisher: Ukrainian Historical and Educational Center of NJ Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-02-03T10:52-0500

repository.corpname: Ukrainian Historical and Educational Center of NJ Archives

did.langmaterial: Primarily Ukrainian, but also German, English, and Belarusian.
did.abstract: This collection contains material relating to the rebirth of the Ukrainian Autocephalous Orthodox Church in Nazi-occupied Ukraine and its continued existence in exile in post-war Germany.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In principle, this collection would be more properly broken into two and named something like "Ukrainian Autocephalous Orthodox Church Records. Rivne Eparchy. Bishop (1942-1943 : Platon)" and "Ukrainian Autocephalous Orthodox Church Records. Synod of Bishops. Secretary (1944-1951 : Platon)". However, Platon had no predecessor or successor in either of these positions. Therefore, we have chosen to group them together as a single personal collection, even though much of the material is administrative in nature. Given this, it was not clear where to demarcate the boundary between the Platon's papers as Secretary of the Synod of Bishops and the Administrative Records of the UAOC. We have made the decision to include in this collection those materials with which Bishop Platon appears to have had direct involvement based on internal evidence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Bishop Platon Papers contain material relating to the rebirth of the Ukrainian Autocephalous Orthodox Church in Nazi-occupied Ukraine and its continued existence in exile in post-war Germany. The material includes records and correspondence related to the administration of the UAOC, UAOC bishops' council (Sobor) meeting minutes and related documents, records and correspondence pertaining to refugee relief and resettlement, and extensive correspondence with other UAOC hierarchs. These provide a window into the difficulties faced by Ukrainian refugees in post-war Germany and the efforts of the Church to minister to its faithful and deal with the internal conflicts that arose in that unstable time. In addition, this collection contains important information of genealogical interest in the form of employment records and relief aid distribution reports.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in two subcollections: documents dating to his time as Bishop of Rivne, and documents from his period of exile. Within these subcollections, the material is arranged in 7 series as follows.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials
relatedmaterial.p: This collection has considerable overlap with the collections of the other UAOC hierarchs. In addition, the demarcation between this collection and the UAOC Administrative Records Collection is unclear, and interested researchers are urged to consult that collection as well. For an "opposing viewpoint" on the Conciliar schism, see the Fr. Petro Stel'makh Papers.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access and use of this collection may be subject to restrictions. Please contact the archivist (archives@ukrhec.org) for more information and to make arrangements.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Part of the collection of UAOC records kept by Metr. Nikanor. Obtained by the UOC of USA upon Nikanor's death. It is not clear how the material dating to his time in Canada immediately prior to his death ended up as part of this collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Bishop Platon (born Platon Artemiuk) was a hierarch of the Ukrainian Autocephalous Orthodox Church, and served as the Secretary of that Church's Synod of Bishops during post-war exile in Germany. He was born on December 18, 1891 in the village of Nosov, Bilo-Pidlas'kyi county in the Kholm region of Ukraine. He completed the Bilo-Pidlas'kyi Teacher's Seminary in 1910 and worked as a teacher for 3 years before entering the Teacher's Institue in Vilnius, which he completed in 1916. He was ordained a priest on March 15, 1936 by Metr. Oleksii (Hromads'kyi) and assigned to the parish in the village of Novostavtsi in the Rivne area of Volyn'. He was ordained as the UAOC bishop of Rivne on August 2, 1942 in Kyiv. Left Rivne for Warsaw as a refugee on January 14, 1944, and was appointed Secretary of the Synod of Bishops of the UAOC by the Warsaw Sobor. He remained Secretary of the Synod in Germany throughout the DP era. He resettled in Toronto, Canada in 1951, where he died in the same year.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Handwritten drafts and typescripts of notifications sent to clergy in the Rivne eparchy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes requests from clergy to join the UAOC and matters regarding monasteries in the Rivne diocese, including allegations of the theft of church property.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and documents related to the sharing of the Sobor of the Resurrection in Rivne between the Autocaphalous and Autonomous factions. Petition signed by approx. 1000 parishoners of the Sobor requesting to join the UAOC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correpondence with Metr. Polikarp, the Nazi occupational authorities, and others regarding Bp. Fotii.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records of applications for official credentials by clergy, choir directors, cantors, parish board members and others in the employ of the UAOC. Correspondece with clergy seeking to join the UAOC. Autobiographical information. Passport-style photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Parish information forms for Germany and Austria. Clergy information forms for clergy who emigrated from Germany with information about where they settled.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Baptism (1946-1950) and pre-matrimonial statement (1946-1950) records from the Stuttgart-Zuffenhausen DP camp. Baptism (1946-1948) and matrimony (1946-1950) records from Ulm DP camp. Baptism records from Esslingen (?) or from Baden-Württemberg in general (?) (1945-1947). Statements by converts to Orthodoxy. Depositions regarding baptism and marraiges. Divorce cases.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with and reports to the World Council of Churches Refugee Division. UAOC clergy directories and aid distribution reports. Correspondence with and reports from clergy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Primarily correspondence with and reports from Fr. Mykola Laszczuk in Dillingen, who served as a representative of the UAOC with the refugee division of the World Council of Churches. Also correspondence with UAOC British Zone administration, United Ukrainian American Relief Committee, Fr. Ivan Perelaznyi, Semen Veremchuk, Leontii Starostenko, Fr. Terentii Havryk, Fr. Shevchuk, Fr. Leonid Dolyns'kyi, Fr. Mykola Kharishchak, Fr. Ilarii Zhukovs'kyi, Fr. V. Umanets', Fr. Aleksander Tsyhaniuk, Bp. Hennadij, Abp. Ihor, and others with illegible signatures. Lists of clergy wishing to emigrate. Extensive lists (arranged by DP Camp) of non-Church individuals wishing to emigrate via Church World Service or ZUDAK, with birthdates and occupations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Material related to the preparation for and organization of the All-Church Conference which took place in Regensburg on 25-27 December 1947. Invitation letters to organizations. Delegate list. Minutes of organization meeting. Correspondence with hierarchs Ihor, Volodymyr, Hennadii, Nikanor, Fr. F. Kul'chynevs'kyi, Fr. Iakovlevych, M. Holobenko, Ievhen Tyravskyi, and Ivan Vlasovs'kyi. Minutes of the Conference itself. Manuscripts of lectures presented at the Conference. Letters of greeting from Bp. Aleksander, Mykhailo Omelianovych, Mykhailo Hikavyi, and the Ukrains'ke Khrystyians'ke Obiednannia IMKA-IVKA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Original signed minutes of meetings of the Sobor of Bishops. Encyclicals. Parish bylaws. Syllibi for religious instruction in elementary schools and Gymnasia. Minutes of meetings of March 14-17, 1946 (Esslingen), June 14-17, 1946 (Esslingen), August 23-26, 1946 (Munich), November 19-23, 1946 (Cornberg), May 10-15, 1947 (Munich), August 5-8, 1947 (Mainz-Kastel), October 21-24, 1947 (extraordinary meeting in Aschaffenburg), April 15-17 and 19-20, 1948 (Augsburg), November 12-14, 1948 (Ellwangen), June 15-17, 1949 (Munich), and November 1-5, 1949 (Dillingen).

did.unittitle: Addenda to Minutes of Sobor of Bishops

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with Bp. Viacheslav, Bp. Serhii, Bp. Sylvestr, Abp. Hennadii, Abp. Nikanor, Abp. Ihor, I. Harashchenko, P. Kovaliv, Korovyts'kyi (?), Levkovych (?). Encyclical from UAOC hierarchs to all other Orthodox Churches. Text of address by Metr. Polikarp to the Sobor of Bishops. Temporary bylaws of the UAOC. Manuscripts of lectures (?).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Program of the Sobor. Letter from Belarusian Autocephalous Orthodox Church. Correspondence from Abp. Hennadii, Abp. Ihor, Bp. Volodymyr, Bp. Syl'vestr, Fr. Demyd Burko, Fr. Nykola Voiakovsky (Ukrainian Catholic Apostolic Visitator), Antokhii (?), and individuals with illegible signatures. Drafts of syllibi for religious education in gymnasia. Draft of letter to General Secretary of the UN. Handwritten draft of Church bylaws. Financial statement. Petition from Ellwangen parish regarding the mis-behavior of Bp. Syl'vestr. Bylaws of the "Trudova Hromada" ("Work Community") of the Ukrainian Orthodox Church in Regensburg.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Draft program of the Sobor. Bylaws of the "Ukrains'koho Pravoslavnoho Bratstva Myloserdia". Correspondence with Ivan Vlasovskyi regarding the Scientific-Theological Institute. Correspondence with, and minutes of meetings of the Ukrains'koho Natsional'no-Derzhavnoho Soiuzu. Correspondence with Bp. Viacheslav, Bp. Volodymyr, Abp. Palladii, Abp. Nikanor, Fr. Nikola Voiakovs'kyi, A. Bilous, Vasyl' Bozhko, I. Iaroslavs'kyi (Buenos Aires). Draft of press release.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Draft of Sobor program. Handwritten report on the activities of the Synod during 1946. Financial and budget reports. Petition to Metr. Polikap. Petition to the Sobor from the Conciliarist "Initiative Group" (I. Harashchenko). Correspondence with Bp. Mstyslav, Bp. Viacheslav, Bp. Syl'vestr, Prof. Palyvoda (Ukrainian Central Aid Committee). Press release. Correspondence with Pro Una Sancta Ecclesia (Munich).

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Contains three files, two of which were clearly labeled as being associated with the Munich Sobor, while the third has been attributed to this session based on the dates of the items.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sobor program. Petition from clergy of the Hanover region. Minutes of the meeting of the clergy of the Hanover region. Copies of excerpts of the minutes of meettings of UAOC bishops in Mannheim (August 1945), Bad Kissingen (July 1945), and Munich (November 1945). Correspondence with Metr. Polikarp, Abp. Ioann, Abp. Mykhail, Bp. Hryhorii, Fr. Tyt Iakovkevych, Fr. Ol. Popivs'kyi, Fr. Dmytro Fokii, Fr. Nykolai Voiakovs'kyi, Fr. Mytrofan Iatsuna, Fr. Diatelovych, M. Mukha, M Nenashiv, and others with illegible signatures. Invitation from the Ukrainian Central Aid Committee to attend the May 1947 Convention. Instructions for church elders. Bylaws of the Ukrainian Orthodox Brotherhood of Mercy. Ukrainian DP camp newspaper, Somme-Kaserne, August 2, 1947.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This file was originally arranged as part of Addenda to Sobors of Bishops, but not labeled with the session. It has been attributed to the Mainz-Kastel session based on internal evidence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Draft of Sobor program. Drafts of letters by Bp. Platon. Correspondence with P. Kovaliv and Abp. Mykhail regarding the Theological-Scientific Academy. Minutes of the meeting of the Senate and Council of Professors of the Academy. Correspondence with Bp. Volodymyr regarding the Theological-Pedagogical Academy and other matters. Correspondece with Metr. Polikarp, Metr. Ilarion, Abp. Hennadii, Abp. Nikanor, Abp. Ihor, Abp. Palladii, Bp. Syl'vestr, Bp. Viacheslav, Fr. Illia Nahirniak, Fr. Perelaznyi, Fr. Petro Stel'makh, Fr. M. Iatsun, Fr. Demyd Burko, Fr. K. Danylavs'kyi, Fr. Semen Haiuk, I. Bakalo, I. Harashchenko, Dmytro Shulika, the "Bat'kivs'kyi Komitet" ("Parent's Committee") in Ellwangen, the Sanitary Charitable Service, Union of Ukrainian Invalids, the Ukrainian Orthodox parish in Bayreuth, and others with illegible signatures. Petitions from parishoners at Mainz-Kastel, Somme Kaserne, Regensburg, Lyssenko Camp in Hanover, Dillingen, and others. Minutes of meeting of the Brotherhood of St. Volodymyr (Augsburg). Correspondence from the office of the Secretary of the Synod (A. Teodorovych, secretary).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sobor program. Opening address by Metr. Polikarp. Handwritten manuscript of report on Synodal activities for 1947. Report from Bp. Serhii. Requests for clerical awards by Bps. Volodymyr and Viacheslav. Parish list and meeting minutes for the Greater Hessen region. Correspondence of Bp. Syl'vestr, Abp. Nikanor, Fr. Leonid Dolyns'kyi.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sobor program. Handwritten drafts of minutes. Handwritten notes. Financial reports. Letter, reports and syllibi from Fr. F. Kul'chyns'kyi regarding religious education. Reports from V. Kovaliv and Bp. Volodymyr regarding the Theological Academy. Correspondence with Metr. Polikarp, Abp. Mykhail, Abp. Ihor, Bp. Viacheslav, Bp. Serhii, Bp. Syl'vestr, Fr. Iurii Peleshuk, Fr. Vasyl' Bulavka, Fr. Leonid Dolyns'kyi, Fr. L. Kravchuk, Fr. Oleksander Shcherban, Fr. Semen Haiuk, Fr. Borys Iakovkevych, Fr. Boris Korvin-Kamenskii, Anatolii Kotovych, P. Kurinnyi (UVAN), Sava Tymchyk, Andrii Novyts'kyi, Hryhorii Vovk, Andrii Pererva, the Sanitary Charitable Service, the Brotherhood of Mercy and others with illegible signatures. Parish bylaws.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sobor program. Inventory of the property of the Synod. Financial reports. Report from the Theological Academy. Reports by Metr. Polikarp on various geographical regions (France, Brazil, Germany-British Zone, Australia, UK, Paraguay, Austria, Venezuela, Argentina, USA and Canada, Belgium). Report from Metr. Polikarp regarding Bp. Viacheslav. Copies of correspondence from Venezuela and Argentina. Correspondence with Abp. Mykhail, Abp. Ihor, Bp. Viacheslav, Fr. Iurii Peleshuk, Fr. N. Ovcharenko, Fr. Mykola Liashchuk, Anatolii Kotovych, the Union of Ukrainians in Germany (Munich office), the Ukrainian Geneological Institute (Ukrains'ka Rodovidna Ustanova). Published "memorandum" to the Ukrainian National Council from the UAOC(C). Copy of letter from the Ukrainian National Council to Ecumenical Patriarch Athenagoras. Handwritten minutes and drafts of resolutions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Program. Attendee list. Handwritten notes. Report on the activity of the Office of the Synod of Bishops. Financial reports. Lists of clergy who have emigrated and are still in Germany. Notes regarding the Sanitary Charitable Service. Report regarding Bp. Syl'vestr. Correspondence with Abp. Hennadii, Abp. Ihor, Abp. Mykhail, Bp. Volodymyr, Bp. Serhii, Bp. Viacheslav, Rev. H. Becker (Church World Service/IRO), Fr. Iurii Peleshuk, Fr. Mykolai Liashchuk and the Dillingen parish council, Fr. Petro Ivanovs'kyi, Fr. Petro Hranovs'kyi, Fr. Illia Nahirniak, Fr. Petro Kasianchuk, Anatolii Kotovych, Chuiko (Dillingen camp commandant), the Australian Military Mission (DP Branch), the Association of Ukrainian Veterans. Copy of letter from Danylo Skoropadskyi.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Also includes correspondence with Abp. Ihor, Fr. Oleksander Dovhal', Fr. Iurii Turzhans'kyi [?] and another correspondent with illegible signature regarding Bp. Hryhorii and copies of correspondence from Metr. Polikarp to Bp. Hryhorii. Report by Fr. Ananii Teodorvych.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In addition, contains copies of correspondence between Ioann and Abp. Polikarp.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In addition to correspondence with Bp. (later Abp.) Mstyslav, also contains copies of correspondence of Metr. Polikarp with Mstyslav and Metr. Ioann, correspondence with Fr. D. Fotii and Fr. Danyliuk, copies of correspondence, press releases and other items from Mstyslav's office, and correspondence from Platon's office on behalf of Mstyslav.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence from third parties to Abp. Mykhail which were forwarded to Bp. Platon, as well as correspondence of Bp. Platon related to correspondence with Abp. Mykhail. Correspondence with the Church Administration office for Bavaria.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Also includes correspondence with Fr. I. Hubarzhevs'kyi, the United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration, the US and British Military Government and Rev. Walter Lack, forwarded letters to Metr. Polikarp from Fr. Hryhorii Antokhiv and M. Tode, copies of letters from D. Volkovs'kyi and to Bp. Mykhail, and copy of report from Fr. Iurii Kovalenko regarding a meeting on refugee resettlement with the World Council of Churches.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Additional correspondence from Fr. V. Umanets[kyi?], Fr. Borys Maslovs'kyi, Fr. Ivan Magas, M. Zalis'kyi, [?] Vakhoms'kyi[?], and other illegible signatures. Correspondence from members of Russian Orthodox community in Constance, including P. Senitzkii. Notes on the history of the UAOC in Constance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In addition to the Syl'vestr correspondence, also includes correspondence with the rector of the parish in Ellwangen (name illegible), a prisoner of war postcard from Mykola Maluzhynskyi to Bp. Mykhail, and Syl'vestr's holiday pastoral letters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Also includes letters from Fr. Ferestiuk [?] and another illegible signature.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Also includes letter from Fr. Ipolit Shemetylo, Fr. Tyt Iakovkevych, and Ivan Vlasovs'kyi.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with Mykola Zabello, the leader of the Ukrainian community in Istanbul, Turkey, primarily on matters relating to the Ecumenical Patriarchate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with clergy and other employees of the UAOC that left or were about to leave Germany to the USA, Canada, Australia, Belgium, and Venezuela, including Fr. Anatoli Strushyns'kyi, Deacon Mykola Krytiuk, Fr. Petro Pankrativ, Fr. Pavel Fal'ko, Fr. Epyfanii Chyzhov (Chyzhiv), Fr. Mykhailo Kozariichuk, Fr. V. Varvariv, Fr. Stepan Hredil', Fr. Mykhailo Fliak, Fr. Vasyl' Boichuk, cantor V. Shpak, and others with illegible signatures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Primarily correspondence with clergy, including Fr. Terentii Havryk, Deacon Lazar Takhtarenko, Fr. Fomichevs'kyi, Fr. Kharyton Dorohyn, Fr. Vasyl' Umanets', Fr. Vasyl' Ilins'kyi, Fr. Ipolit Shemetylo, Deacon Ievhenii Mahdych, Fr. Mykhailo Hil'taichuk, and others with illegible signatures. Also includes a clergy circular and correspondence with the military authorities regarding the liquidation of the Lehbühlstrasse DP camp in Landshut.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with the Ukrainain National Council (Ukrains'ka Natsional'na Rada), the Union of Ukrainians in Germany (Soiuz Ukraintsiv u Nimechchyni), Andrij Livyts'kyi, and Borys Ivanyts'kyi. Pamphlet "Documents of Ukrainian Foreign Policy".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with the Society of Students of the Theological Academy (Munich) and Society of Ukrainian Orthodox Students (Erlangen).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, primarily with director Panteleimon Kovaliv. Constitution, minutes, reports. Request to German ministries for salaries. Poems. Corresponce with hierarchs Hennadii, Sylvestr. Programs of opening ceremony and 1 year anniversary.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence related to the ordination of Bp. Vasili for the BAOC. Original episcopal ordination "Profession of Faith" document. Correspondence with Metr. Polikarp, Bp. Serhij, the Belarusian Orthodox Brotherhood of Zyrovitsy, the Belarusian National Republic in Exile, and other Belarusian exile groups.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records and correspondence related to the defrocking of Fr. Iakiv Kindzeriavyi-Pastukhiv and controversy regarding the assignment of clergy to the Ingolstadt DP camp church. Correspondence with Fr. Iakiv Kindzeriavyi-Pastukhiv, Abp. Ihor, Abp. Mykhail, Ingolstadt DP camp administration, Ingolstadt UAOC church council, Fr. Teodozii Diatelovych, Fr. V. Varvariv, UAOC adminstration office for Bavaria, Fr. Leonid Dolyns'kyi, and UNRRA Director T. G. M. Davidson. Report and minutes of UAOC Church Court. Petitions from parisioners.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with Fr. Illia Nahirniak, Abp. Ihor, and General Mykola Kapustians'kyi regarding the conflict between Fr. Nahirniak and Abp. Ihor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents regarding conflicts within the Regensburg DP camp parish as well as between the parish and the UAOC administration. Correspondence with the parish board, Abp. Mykhail, Fr. K. Danylevs'kyi, Fr. Borys Iakovkevych, Bp. Sylvestr, Bp. Mstyslav, Bp. Volodymyr, and parishoners. Fr. K. Danylevs'kyi clergy information form. Meeting minutes. Parish bylaws.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents related to the Conciliar schism and the UAOC parish in Mannheim. Correspondence with Fr. M. Iatsun, M. Sadovskyi, Fr. Stepan Pozykhailo, Fr. Demyd Burko, Fr. Mytrofan Iavdas', Fr. Illia Nahirniak, Abp. Ihor, Bp. Sylvestr, and the Mannheim parish board. Meeting minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents related to UAOC in France, especially Paris. Correspondence with Fr. Volodymyr Vyshnevs'kyi, Symon Sozontiv, and the UAOC parish board in Paris.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with UAOC Administration in the UK, including administrator Fr. Ihor Hubarzhevs'kyi, and M. Krat.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with Fr. Vasyl' Vyshyvan, Fr. Dmytro Fokii, Fr. Petro Stefiuk, Fr. Petro Pankratii, Dmytro Papenko, and others related to UAOC church administration in Austria.
